meanings.sent1: I saw the cat flump off the table.
meanings.sent2: The books flump to the ground as I tripped.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to juggle but ended up flumping onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: The tired hiker's backpack seemed to flump down with a sigh of relief.
meanings.sent5: The snowman's head flumped off its body with a soft thud.

meanings.sent1: The flump of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: The distant flump of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The old tree made a flump as it fell in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The heavy flump of the rock hitting the ground startled the birds.
meanings.sent5: The flump of the door closing made the house feel empty.

meanings.definition: A soft, heavy noise or movement
meanings.sent1: The flump of the pillow hitting the bed was comforting.
meanings.sent2: The flump of the cat landing on the carpet was barely audible.
meanings.sent3: The flump of the rain on the roof made me sleepy.
meanings.sent4: The flump of the snow falling outside created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The flump of the baby's toy hitting the floor made her giggle.
